article_title: Japan Growth Must Come First to Fix Debt Woes, Says S&P Analyst
article_text:
TOKYO—A tax increase that undermined growth would be a minus for Japan’s economy, says an analyst at Standard & Poor’s Ratings Services, suggesting that growth considerations should take precedence over plans to raise taxes.

“The growth rate is everything,” Takahira Ogawa told The Wall Street Journal in an interview, noting the importance of stoking stable inflation to boost nominal growth and increase tax receipts.

article_metadata.author: Takashi Nakamichi
article_metadata.article.origheadline: Japan Growth Must Come First to Fix Debt Woes, Says S&P Analyst

article_summary:
TOKYO—A tax increase that undermined growth would be a minus for Japan’s economy, says an analyst at Standard & Poor’s Ratings Services, suggesting that growth considerations should take precedence over plans to raise taxes.
“The growth rate is everything,” Takahira Ogawa told The Wall Street Journal in an interview, noting the importance of stoking stable inflation to boost nominal growth and increase tax receipts.
